alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 25 at 3:35AM PST until February 26 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW TO IMPACT STEVENS PASS... .Snow will develop Saturday night and become heavy Sunday morning. Steady snow will transition to snow showers Sunday afternoon and night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Accumulations between 10 and 14 inches for Stevens Pass and higher terrain. Accumulations of 2 to 6 inches for elevations below 4000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph creating blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Holden Village, Stehekin, and Stevens Pass. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of one inch per hour are expected at times Sunday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
